## The Heart of Structured Programming

This is how we impose structure on our disordered world.

We look for identical patterns of code or clutter code (needed code which distracts from the problem at hand).

- Pull them out
- Put them in 1 place.
- Give them a name

::: notes
Clutter code is a good place to look at first - headers or footers, prompts. housekeeping stuff.
::: 

## Creating a Function

```{.cpp } 
// 6-1.cpp -- Demo of functions
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

// Function Prototype
void DisplayMessage();

int main() {                          // function 1
    cout << "Hello from main()\n";
    DisplayMessage();                 // call function 2
    cout << "Hello from main() again\n";

    return 0;
}

void DisplayMessage() {
    cout << "Hello from DisplayMessage()\n";
}
```

## Function Location

A function can go above or below main(). 

The style in this language is to place them below main() AND use function prototypes.


## Function Calls in a Function

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="75%"}

```{.cpp code-line-numbers="5|9|15|16|17|9|10|11|5|6|7|12|13|18"}  
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

void Deeper() {
    cout << "Now inside function Deeper()\n";
}

void Deep() {
    cout << "Hello from Deep()\n";
    Deeper();
    cout << "Now back in Deep() again\n";
}

int main() {                 // function 1
    cout << "Hello from main()\n";
    Deep();
    cout << "Hello from main() again\n";

    return 0;
}
```

## Same thing but with Function Prototype

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="75%"}

```{.cpp code-line-numbers="5|6|8|9|10|16|17|18|22|23|24|19|20|11"}  
// 6-4.cpp -- Functions calling functions
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

// Function Prototype
void Deep();
void Deeper();

int main() {        
    cout << "Hello from main()\n";
    Deep();
    cout << "Hello from main() again\n";

    return 0;
}

void Deep() {
    cout << "Hello from Deep()\n";
    Deeper();
    cout << "Now back in Deep() again\n";
}

void Deeper() {
    cout << "Now inside function Deeper()\n";
}
```
:::

::: {.column width="25%"}

![Output](topics/functions/images/funcDemo2aOut.png) 

:::
:::

## We can call but not define

Notice we did not define a function inside another function, we just called it.

Defining a function inside a function is called **nesting** and is not allowed with functions in this language.
